snippet.textDisplay: Personally, I think it's unfair to compare Perfect Dark to Halo.  They don't play the same, don't have the same mood and one is mission based while the other is a lenghty campaign.  It is ironic that some people slam one dev but praise the other.  Rare did to the N64 what Bungie did to the original Xbox:  it prevented a console from being totally shred to pieces by the competition.
snippet.textOriginal: Personally, I think it's unfair to compare Perfect Dark to Halo.  They don't play the same, don't have the same mood and one is mission based while the other is a lenghty campaign.  It is ironic that some people slam one dev but praise the other.  Rare did to the N64 what Bungie did to the original Xbox:  it prevented a console from being totally shred to pieces by the competition.

snippet.textDisplay: On paper, Perfect Dark was superior to Goldeneye in every way. But Goldeneye usually ends up being the favored game. Its hard for me to choose, I LOVE the HELL out of both. But I do know that I had way more awesome multiplayer session in Goldeneye than I did Perfect Dark. If only Perfect Dark Zero didn't captured the esscence of this game, It woulda been awesome.
snippet.textOriginal: On paper, Perfect Dark was superior to Goldeneye in every way. But Goldeneye usually ends up being the favored game. Its hard for me to choose, I LOVE the HELL out of both. But I do know that I had way more awesome multiplayer session in Goldeneye than I did Perfect Dark. If only Perfect Dark Zero didn't captured the esscence of this game, It woulda been awesome.

snippet.textDisplay:
Just beat this game the other day for the first time ever.  This track actually plays after the ending credits roll. Not a bad theme.

The campaign was pretty subpar and boring in this game, especially compared to its predecessor, but the multiplayer was superior to Goldeneye. The bots were a great addition. I think Goldeneye holds up better looking back, but Perfect Dark was the better game when it was released.
snippet.textOriginal:
Just beat this game the other day for the first time ever.  This track actually plays after the ending credits roll. Not a bad theme.

The campaign was pretty subpar and boring in this game, especially compared to its predecessor, but the multiplayer was superior to Goldeneye. The bots were a great addition. I think Goldeneye holds up better looking back, but Perfect Dark was the better game when it was released.

snippet.textDisplay:
Perfect Dark perfected every aspect of Goldeneye (except the story maybe). 
Soundtrack wise, I'll say both are pretty much on par. Both have very memorable songs, and the atmosphere they created are really appropriate with their respective game. I'll go with PD as the best OST, especially with the "X" version of some songs (Extraction!).
But I can't deny the power of some GE tracks (Silo or the Main Theme among others).
snippet.textOriginal:
Perfect Dark perfected every aspect of Goldeneye (except the story maybe). 
Soundtrack wise, I'll say both are pretty much on par. Both have very memorable songs, and the atmosphere they created are really appropriate with their respective game. I'll go with PD as the best OST, especially with the "X" version of some songs (Extraction!).
But I can't deny the power of some GE tracks (Silo or the Main Theme among others).

snippet.textDisplay: Awesome game, though I didn't find it quite as good and memorable as Goldeneye. It has some pretty awesome music, which was expected from Rare games. Oh and I know some people who never noticed  the alien in Joanna Dark's eye. :P Speaking of her, I already mentioned it previously but she's voiced by Eveline Fischer, the composer of DKC3 and some of the music in DKC.
snippet.textOriginal: Awesome game, though I didn't find it quite as good and memorable as Goldeneye. It has some pretty awesome music, which was expected from Rare games. Oh and I know some people who never noticed  the alien in Joanna Dark's eye. :P Speaking of her, I already mentioned it previously but she's voiced by Eveline Fischer, the composer of DKC3 and some of the music in DKC.
